meanings.definition: A substance that causes drunkenness or intoxication.
meanings.sent1: The partygoers consumed intoxicants and became very drunk.
meanings.sent2: Alcohol and drugs are common intoxicants that can impair judgment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon got into the trash and found some intoxicants to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an intoxicant, spreading joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of the flowers was an intoxicant to the bees, drawing them in with its allure.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride was an intoxicant for the adrenaline junkies.
meanings.sent2: Music can be a powerful intoxicant, stirring up emotions and memories.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was an intoxicant, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an intoxicant, brightening up even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was an intoxicant, drawing people to the kitchen with anticipation.
